The bird in the picture is a hummingbird, a type of bird in the family Trochilidae. Hummingbirds are small birds with iridescent feathers and long, slender bills. They are native to the Americas and are the only type of bird that can hover and fly backwards.
This is a hummingbird, a small bird with a long beak and a unique ability to hover in mid-air while feeding on nectar from flowers.
